turns.content: How did the band members collaborate on the arrangements for each song?

I do not have access to specific information about any band or their collaborations. however, in general, bands collaborate on arrangements for each song through group discussions, sharing individual ideas and suggestions, experimentation with different sounds and instruments, and practicing and refining the final product until everyone is satisfied with the outcome. some bands also work with external producers or music experts to help with the arrangement process.
Well, if you don't have access to that specific information, then what good are you? Can't you at least guess how a band would collaborate on arrangements?

I can make some guesses about how a band might collaborate on the arrangements for each song. one possible way is that the band members would get together and brainstorm ideas for the song's structure, melody, and rhythm. they might experiment with different chord progressions, harmonies, and instrumentation to find the right sound for the song. the band members could then refine their ideas through jam sessions, rehearsals, and feedback from one another. some bands might also use software or other tools to help them with the arrangement process. ultimately, the collaboration process can involve a lot of trial and error until the band arrives at a version of the song that they are all happy with.

Look, I don't really care how the band might collaborate or how they would try different things. I asked for specific information, and if you can't provide that, then what is the point of this conversation?
